definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: Kanas Lake is located in Northern Xinjiang, China, forceful Johnson show, picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 喀納斯湖位於中國新疆北部，雄渾嬌秀，風景如畫。

sentences.english: In artistic style, Tang poetry is majestic, and Song poetry is graceful and restrained.
sentences.chinese: 三是藝術風格不同，唐詩雄渾，而宋詩婉麗。

sentences.english: Hill with thick, which has the final calendar vicissitudes.
sentences.chinese: 山以其厚重，歷滄桑而爲之雄渾。

sentences.english: Their voices are strong and pure.
sentences.chinese: 他們的聲音雄渾而純淨。

sentences.english: Barack's father was self assured and reportedly had a very deep voice.
sentences.chinese: 據說老奧是一個很自信且聲音很雄渾的一個人。

definition: bold/upright and strong/vigorous/forceful (brush strokes)/sureness of touch
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
